name: Entrepreneurship for Computer Scientists
long_desc: This course is primarily for nonbusiness school students it includes most of Introduction to Entrepreneurship 70415, assumes no background courses in business and involves additional sessions for core business concepts. Students with majors in science, technology, engineering or computer science are exposed to fundamental concepts and issues in innovation, business and entrepreneurship. Students can expect to gain a basic understanding of functional areas such as finance, funding, marketing, sales and management. Student Status Sophomore year or higher.
